content: _format can be used to specify the format if Accept can't be set by the client. And it overrides the Accept if it is present. Should _format allow for ;fhir-version=X as well then?

Spot testing with Postman suggests that most servers do not handle _format=application/xml+fhir;fhirVersion=3.0 at all well. Results range from bad request responses to just ignoring the entire _format parameter
no I dont' think I thought of supporting that
https://test.fhir.org/r4 just ignores the entire _format parameter if we add the fhirVersion mime parameter.
